page.title: 07Housing in Emborough
page.content: Farmhouses are scattered across this area and are the predominant type of housing. Some are newer houses but most are stone build and many years old. There are two short terraces both thought to have been built to house farm workers. There has been little new building in the area since then. On the road to Chilcompton there is a former Toll House erected by the Wells Turnpike Trust, which was moved to its present position i 1835 to include the traffic of coal which would hae otherwise avoided the toll. The population of the area is quite static and houses only come up for sale infrequently and as there is little new building many young people are forced to move away to find accomodation.
